categories.title: Recent Dependency Updates in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text: The elizaOS/eliza repository has undergone numerous dependency updates through multiple pull requests. These updates include both regular dependency maintenance and security fixes.

Major updates include Solana packages to v1.98.0, typescript-eslint to ^8.26.0, and PNPM to v9.15.7. The repository also updated several AI-related dependencies including ai to v4.1.54, @ai-sdk/mistral to v1.1.15, and langchain to ^0.3.11.

Development tools were also updated, including @coral-xyz/anchor to v0.30.1, @vitejs/plugin-react-swc to ^3.8.0, and docusaurus-plugin-typedoc to v1.2.3. A security update was applied to the black Python dependency, upgrading it to v24.

Other notable updates include zod to v3.24.2, js-tiktoken to v1.0.19, glob to v11.0.1, @octokit/rest to ^21.1.0, @fal-ai/client to v1.2.3, and @deepgram/sdk to ^3.11.1. The repository also migrated its Renovate configuration and pinned several testing framework dependencies.

# Feature Additions

The Eliza project has received several feature enhancements:
- Core types have been added (PR #3875)
- Optional Venice system prompt removal functionality has been implemented (PR #3583)
- Documentation for Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE) has been added (PR #2876)

# Bug Fixes

Numerous bug fixes have been implemented:
- Fixed missing moment rollup external (PR #3876)
- Fixed playwright/patchright and database environment loading issues (PR #3808)
- Fixed PostgreSQL migration issues (PR #3803)
- Fixed main Docker errors (PR #3790)
- Improved agent construction of character plugins for runtime (PR #3458)
- Fixed Amazon Bedrock as LLM provider (PR #3329)

Additionally, several dependency updates were made to fix issues:
- Updated pnpm to v9.15.7
- Updated zod to v3.24.2
- Updated langchain to ^0.3.11
- Updated js-tiktoken to v1.0.19
- Updated glob to v11.0.1
- Updated ai to v4.1.54
- Updated @octokit/rest to ^21.1.0
- Updated @fal-ai/client to v1.2.3
- Updated @deepgram/sdk to ^3.11.1
- Updated @ai-sdk/mistral to v1.1.15

# Documentation Improvements

The project's documentation has been enhanced:
- JSDoc documentation updates for multiple files (PR #3806)
- Turkish documentation has been added (PR #3422, #3809)
- Attempted addition of Romanian readme (PR #2151, marked as conflicted)
- Revamping of Portuguese-Brazil README for clearer instructions (PR #2156, marked as conflicted)

# Maintenance and Infrastructure

Several maintenance and infrastructure improvements were made:
- Updated Solana packages to v1.98.0
- Updated various dependencies including typescript-eslint, docusaurus-plugin-typedoc, and @vitejs/plugin-react-swc
- Updated @coral-xyz/anchor to v0.30.1
- Migrated Renovate configuration
- Updated Docker login action
- Pinned various dependencies
- Updated black to v24 for security reasons
- Updated secret variable for autodocs
- Implemented singleton PostgreSQL connection
- CI improvements to collect artifacts for diagnosing memory issues

categories.title: Recent Tech Discussions and AI Developments

content.text: Twitter user @dankvr shared a preview of a concept from @anarchyarcade, expressing excitement with 'itshappening.gif'. In a related tweet, they mentioned AI agents being coded to simulate DAO governance decisions.

The user criticized @PalmerLuckey for negative comments about Project M, defending the mod as an example of 'permissionless innovation' that captured the feel of Melee and enabled user-generated content.

According to @dankvr, Grok reports that intelligence agency spending has increased by approximately $30.3 billion from FY 2013 to FY 2025, showing real growth even after accounting for inflation. The user also noted it's been 12 years since the Snowden leaks, wondering what intelligence agencies are currently developing.

@dankvr shared progress on automating various tasks using AI, including technical documentation generation, responses to developer questions, ecosystem newsletters, and media shows. They referenced Vitalik Buterin's concept of 'AI as the engine, humans as the steering wheel' and mentioned using tools to generate ecosystem updates that would be human-reviewed before publishing.

Twitter user @shawmakesmagic made several comments about AI, including criticizing vector databases as a 'VC grift', making a humorous request to Anthropic about Claude, and sharing something about 'Eliza v2 Hacking'.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository addressing various features and fixes:

- PR #3806 by madjin focuses on JSDoc documentation updates across multiple files, improving code documentation.

- PR #3359 by tercel adds pagination support and account status management functionality across database adapters, though it's currently marked as conflicted.

- PR #3881 by think-in-universe fixes issues with NEAR AI image generation functionality.

- PR #3876 by ChristopherTrimboli addresses missing moment rollup external dependencies and issues with 'the-org'.

- PR #3878 by AIFlowML includes fixes for the plugin-telegram component.

Here's a snapshot of current cryptocurrency prices:

• WBTC (Wrapped Bitcoin): $86,032.54
• WETH (Wrapped Ethereum): $2,201.97
• SOL (Solana): $136.91
• ai16z: $0.20

These prices represent the current market values for these digital assets as of the latest update.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From March 8-9, 2025, there were 72 new pull requests with 36 merged, no new issues, and 35 active contributors. Activity decreased the following day (March 9-10, 2025) with only 2 new pull requests (1 merged), 3 new issues, and 10 active contributors.
sources: From 2025-03-08 to 2025-03-09, elizaos/eliza had 72 new PRs (36 merged), 0 new issues, and 35 active contributors.
From 2025-03-09 to 2025-03-10, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (1 merged), 3 new issues, and 10 active contributors.

content.text: The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.

Development focused on package improvements with 9 contributors merging 26 PRs. Renovate is updating various dependencies across different packages, including anthropic, @langchain/openai, bs58, and docusaurus-plugin-typedoc (to v1.2.3).
